attributes.comment:
As an individual adopting internationally, I have to tell you that this proposed
increase will not only increase the financial hardship already incurred by
adoptive parents. It will most definitely increase the general frustration with
government entities in their consistent "red tape" surrounding adoption
processes. The government should rather be endorsing such humanity as taking
care of orphans. This will no doubt be a source of disdain among the adoption
community and so viewed upon as discouragement and lack of support from our
countries leaders to support those in need.(I am speaking of the orphans, mostly
in institutes, and impoverished countries.)

Specifically relating to renewal of the I600A form and refingerprinting, it is a
quite unnecessary fee. While it is realized that the initial authorization could
indeed take some time for the USCIS to review, it should be a much easier and
quicker process to renew such a document. For instance, a person's fingerprints
do not change, and therefore they should not need to be refingerprinted, indeed
the original fingerprints should just be recleared through the FBI. Likewise,
the homestudy and copies of BC and Marriage Cert. should be reviewed for any
changes only. If no changes, it should be sufficient to only state this. I could
recognize a greater workload if changes occurred.

The most frustration that arises out of this, is that all International
adoptions are taking longer to complete, resulting from the Hague Agreement, a
government instituted change. Also, the current time of validity for the I171H
is insufficient for its purpose due to this increased time for adoption
completion. Therefore this increased financial hardship upon adoptive families
is directly caused by our US government themselves.

If you have taken the time to read and consider my comments, I thank you deeply.
My concern is much deeper than this, and I hope that you will not increase such
fees, but that the expiration/validity will increase, and the process of I171H
approval with become more cost effective.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Kristy R. Day
